title: The Mirror of Absurdity
theme: A mystical mirror that reflects not faces but sounds, rhymes, and the boundaries of understanding
narrative_arc: Compensation paid → Wisdom cultivated → Sound as color → Dark tones visible → Rhyme patterns → Knowledge shimmers → Streamer flows → Unexpectedly more → Mirror reveals → Boundaries shown → Deceased speak → Blind see → Absurdity appears → Expectations confounded → Direction meaningless → Hindering answers → Released from chains → Excitation dangerous → Wisdom at edge → Side by side → Convert understanding → Undress assumptions → Speech fails → Formerly enough → Understanding increases → Presents given → Pilgrims from East → Building overflows → Mirror freezes
narrative_story: The mirror didn't reflect faces; it reflected sounds and rhymes. To find it, you had to compensate — pay with something precious. Years spent to cultivate wisdom were the currency. The mirror showed sound as color, dark tones as shapes. Every rhyme appeared as a pattern on its surface. Knowledge itself was visible — shimmering, unstable. A streamer of meaning flowed from every reflection. Unexpectedly, the mirror showed more than truth. It showed boundaries — where reality ended. The deceased appeared in its depths, still speaking. The blind came to see what their eyes could not. Some visions were absurd — dreams pretending to be prophecy. Those who expected clarity found confusion. Direction meant nothing here. Some answers hindered more than helped. Others released the viewer from old chains. The mirror could excite — dangerously so. Wisdom hovered at the edge of madness. Side by side, truth and lies danced. Some viewers learned to convert their understanding completely. Others began to undress their assumptions. When they tried to speak of what they saw, language failed. Formerly, words had been enough. Understanding began to increase. The grateful would make a present of offerings. Pilgrims came from the East. The temple building could barely contain them. In winter, the mirror would freeze — its surface solid as forgotten dreams. The mirror showed everything. Understanding it was the visitor's problem.
